Package tage.audio.joal

Class JOALAudioPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • tage.audio.AudioPlayer
      • tage.audio.joal.JOALAudioPlayer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IAudioPlayer
    public class JOALAudioPlayer
extends AudioPlayer
    This class extends the AudioPlayer abstract class and uses the JOAL Java interface to OpenAL (http://jogamp.org) to provide a JOAL-based audio player. This class is responsible for playing an individual piece of audio.
    Author:
    Kenneth Barnett Modified from the SAGE Audio package for the RAGE game engine by Juan E. Ruiz. Adapted for TAGE by Scott Gordonl
    See Also:
    OpenAL Specification

      • setVolume

        public void setVolume​(int volume)
        Sets the AL_GAIN of this JOALAudioPlayer's sound.

        AL_GAIN defines a scalar amplitude multiplier. As a source attribute, it applies to that particular source only. As a listener attribute, it effectively applies to all sources in the current context. The default 1.0 means that the sound is unattenuated. An AL_GAIN value of 0.5 is equivalent to an attenuation of 6 dB. The value zero equals silence (no contribution to the output mix). Driver implementations are free to optimize this case and skip mixing and processing stages where applicable. The implementation is in charge of ensuring artifact-free (click-free) changes of gain values and is free to defer actual modification of the sound samples, within the limits of acceptable latencies.

        AL_GAIN larger than one (i.e. amplification) is permitted for source and listener. However, the implementation is free to clamp the total gain (effective gain per-source multiplied by the listener gain) to one to prevent overflow.

        setVolume() is passed a value between 0 to 100 and converts it to the range 0.0 to 1.0.

        Parameters:
        volume - - The volume value between 0 and 100 inclusive.

      • getProgress

        public float getProgress()
        Returns the playback progress of this JOALAudioPlayer's sound in seconds.

      • setLocation

        public void setLocation​(org.joml.Vector3f point)
        Sets the AL_POSITION of this JOALAudioPlayer. The location is where the JOALAudioPlayer's sound will originate from.
        Parameters:
        point - - The point in 3D world space the audio player is located at.

      • setVelocity

        public void setVelocity​(org.joml.Vector3f velocity)
        Sets the AL_VELOCITY of this JOALAudioPlayer.

        AL_VELOCITY specifies the current velocity (speed and direction) of the object, in the world coordinate system. Any 3-tuple of valid float/double values is allowed. The object AL_VELOCITY does not affect the source's position. OpenAL does not calculate the velocity from subsequent position updates, nor does it adjust the position over time based on the specified velocity. Any such calculation is left to the application. For the purposes of sound processing, position and velocity are independent parameters affecting different aspects of the sounds.

        Parameters:
        velocity - - The velocity vector of the audio player.

      • setEmitDirection

        public void setEmitDirection​(org.joml.Vector3f direction,
                             float coneAngle)
        Sets the emit direction of the JOALAudioPlayer. Visually you can think of this as setting a "cone" around the audio player which will direct the sound in a particular direction.

        This is accomplished by setting the AL_DIRECTION, AL_CONE_INNER_ANGLE, AND AL_CONE_OUTER_ANGLE source properties of the audio player.

        If AL_DIRECTION does not equal the zero vector, the source is directional. The sound emission is presumed to be symmetric around the direction vector (cylinder symmetry). sources are not oriented in full 3 degrees of freedom, only two angles are effectively needed.

        The zero vector (0,0,0) is the default direction which indicated that the audio source emitted from the audio player is not direction. Specifying a non-zero vector will make the source directional. Specifying a zero vector for a directional source will effectively mark it as non-direction.

        Parameters:
        direction - - The direction in which the sound is emitting from the audio player.
        coneAngle - - The angle (in degrees) of the "cone" around the audio player. Default value is 360 degrees means the sound being emitted from the audio player is omni-directional.

      • getLocation

        public org.joml.Vector3f getLocation()
        Returns the location of this JOALAudioPlayer as a Vector3f.

      • getVelocity

        public org.joml.Vector3f getVelocity()

      • setRollOff

        public void setRollOff​(float rollOff)
        Sets the AL_ROLLOFF_FACTOR of this JOALAudioPlayer.

        This is used for distance attenuation calculations based on inverse distance with rolloff. For distances smaller than AL_MAX_DISTANCE (and, depending on the distance model, larger than AL_REFERENCE_DISTANCE), this will scale the distance attenuation over the applicable range. See section on distance models for details how the attenuation is computed as a function of the distance.

        In particular, AL_ROLLOFF_FACTOR can be set to zero for those sources that are supposed to be exempt from distance attenuation. The implementation is encouraged to optimize this case, bypassing distance attenuation calculation entirely on a per-source basis.

        Parameters:
        rollOff - Values G.T. 1 make the sound get quieter much quicker the further the ear gets from the source. For a value = 0 distance attenuation is disabled. Range: [0, any]
        See Also:
        OpenAL Specification

      • setMinDistance

        public void setMinDistance​(float distance)
        Sets the AL_REFERENCE_DISTANCE of this JOALAudioPlayer.

        AL_REFERENCE_DISTANCE is used for distance attenuation calculations based on inverse distance with rolloff. Depending on the distance model it will also act as a distance threshold below which gain is clamped.

        Sets the minimum distance at which distance attenuation begins.

        Parameters:
        distance - - The sound can't get any louder if we move closer to the emit point than this value; Range: [0, any]
        See Also:
        OpenAL Specification

      • setMaxDistance

        public void setMaxDistance​(float distance)
        Sets the AL_MAX_DISTANCE of this JOALAudioPlayer.

        AL_MAX_DISTANCE is used for distance attenuation calculations based on inverse distance with rolloff. Distances greater than AL_MAX_DISTANCE will be clamped to AL_MAX_DISTANCE.

        Sets the max distance at which the distance attenuation stops.

        Parameters:
        distance - - The sound can't get any quieter if we move further away from the emit point than this value; Range: [0, any]
        See Also:
        OpenAL Specification

      • setPitch

        public void setPitch​(float pitch)
        Sets the AL_PITCH of this JOALAudioPlayer.

        Desired pitch shift, where 1.0 equals identity. Each reduction by 50 percent equals a pitch shift of -12 semitones (one octave reduction). Each doubling equals a pitch shift of 12 semitones (one octave increase). Zero is not a legal value.

        Parameters:
        pitch - Value must be greater than 0.
